intro: Stenogyne coriacea, commonly known as the rough stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and stream banks. Stenogyne coriacea is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the islands.
